intro: Bupleurum setaceum, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Bupleurum setaceum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
